meanings.definition: The quality or state of being primitive.
meanings.sent1: Her primitivity was evident in her love for simple tools and natural materials.
meanings.sent2: The primitivity of the ancient cave paintings fascinated the researchers.
meanings.sent3: Despite his modern surroundings, his primitivity shone through when he tried to start a fire with sticks.
meanings.sent4: The primitivity of the old village was a stark contrast to the bustling city nearby.
meanings.sent5: The primitivity of the handmade pottery gave it a unique charm.

meanings.definition: The condition of being primitive in style or character.
meanings.sent1: The primitivity of the tribal dance was captivating to watch.
meanings.sent2: The primitivity of the early tools showed the ingenuity of our ancestors.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at cooking had a certain primitivity to it, but it tasted surprisingly good.
meanings.sent4: The primitivity of the makeshift shelter reminded them of simpler times.
meanings.sent5: The primitivity of the artwork reflected the artist's connection to nature.
